oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Deric Ruttan - 2017-06-24
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by Deric Ruttan from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on June 24, 2017. Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Deric Ruttan;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (01:22) Opening comments and performer introduction by Abi Tapia / (05:28) Opening comments from Deric / (06:58) His history as a songwriter / (07:30) Story about writing for Dierks Bentley / (10:02) Performs Lot Of Leavin’ Left To Do / (13:57) Comments on the next song / (15:26) Performs Came Here To Forget / (18:57) Answers question about deciding to become a songwriter instead of a performer / (20:55) Answers question about lyrics or music coming first / (21:55) Answers question about how he got to Nashville / (23:33) Comments about next song / (25:44) Performs Any Ol’ Barstool / (29:38) Answers question about getting songs to artists for them to record / (31:02) Answers question about changes from the demo to an artist's master recording / (31:43) Answers question about his thoughts / (33:00) Comments on the next song / (35:31) Performs Mine Would Be You / (39:38) Answers question about his songs as an artist /

(41:04) Answers question about the demo recording of Mine Would Be You and having a male or female vocalist do the singing / (42:05) Answers question about how he got a publishing deal and Don Schlitz story / (43:31) Performs What Was I Thinkin’ / (48:00) Final comments / (48:13) Walk-out music / (50:01) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Ruttan, Deric; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
